alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 23 at 9:04PM CDT until August 29 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana...Arkansas... Bayou Dorcheat Near Springhill affecting Webster and Columbia Parishes. For the Bayou Dorcheat...including Springhill, Dixie Inn, Lake Bistineau...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat Near Springhill. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding of private boat ramps. Move livestock to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 12.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.4 feet on 11/22/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 915 PM CDT.
